fields.description:
The Role:

The Senior Manager of Technical Accounting and Reporting is responsible for:

  • Support the Director of Accounting, as the Company’s subject matter expert on accounting issues for both existing and new FASB and IASB accounting standards.
  • Research new accounting guidance from the FASB, IASB, SEC and other regulatory bodies, including evaluating the impact of new guidance on the Company’s financial statements.
  • Responsible for preparing technical accounting memos documenting the Company’s accounting position/treatment of the accounting matters as they arise.
  • Review and manage technical research on complex accounting issues and prepare documentation outlining conclusions, primarily in the areas of revenue recognition and operations accounting.
  • Maintain Company’s accounting policies and memos, and the creation of new policies. Draft and update global accounting policies as necessary and roll them out internationally.
  • Provide technical accounting support for significant transactions. Assist with and/or complete ad hoc projects as requested (e.g. research and document issues, valuation assistance associated with business combinations, M&A activity, goodwill impairment, segment reporting analysis, etc.)
  • Support Company-wide educational efforts on accounting related issues, including existing and new accounting guidance and policies.
  • Assist with all periodic, quarterly and annual reporting/SEC filings, including Forms 8-K, 10-Q and 10-K - Manage and review documentation preparation, data analysis, integrity validation and filing submission readiness, including interacting on a regular basis with key members of various departments to gather, consolidate and analyze information.
  • Continuously improve the efficiency and effectiveness of reporting. Implement process improvements in reporting and disclosure process, taking a pro-active approach with the goals of streamlining processes, increasing quality and communications and monetary efficiency.
  • Review monthly, quarterly and annual SOX controls over G/L, equity, goodwill and intangibles, and financial reporting processes.
  • May perform other duties as assigned.


Your Skills:

For consideration, you must bring the following skills and behaviors to our team:

Move fast. Speak up. Decide and own. Drive change. Exceed customer needs. These are some of the winning behaviors you’ll need for success at Logitech. In this role you will:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related discipline required. CPA license is required. - Minimum 4 years Big 4 firm experience, 3 - 5 years industry experience preferred.
  • Excellent analytical skills and knowledge of technical accounting matters, US GAAP, SEC regulations.
  • Proficiency with Excel, Word, Powerpoint and Oracle 11i/R12 preferred.
  • Ability to adapt and prioritize in a dynamic environment. Demonstrate a vigilant attention to detail.
  • Strong project management, leadership, relationship development and people management skills. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to communicate in an effective, concise manner.
  • Demonstrates initiative and is self-motivated.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills and ability to make sound decisions.
  • Ability to multi-task and consistently meet deadlines.
  • Results orientation with an ability to manage the overall project, collaborate with different individuals across the organization, and “roll-up the sleeves” in order to accomplish all necessary tasks.
  • Must possess excellent written, presentation and organizational skills
  • Hi-tech industry experience preferred.

Small Company. Big Products.

Logitech is a world leader in products that connect people in a natural, intuitive way to the digital experiences they care about. We develop our products with a powerful blend of artistic design, surprising science, and innovation driven by consumer insight. Our consumer products are designed for popular computing devices--PCs and Macs, tablets and smartphones. Want to be part of this team of innovators?

Logitech is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Logitech are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.
fields.title: Senior Manager, Technical Accounting and Reporting

fields.description:
Prudential Real Estate Investors (PREI) is the real estate investment management business of Prudential Financial. PREI is comprised of fund management centers in the US located in Madison, New Jersey, Atlanta, Chicago, New York and San Francisco. PREI has multiple global offices including: Munich, London, Singapore, Mexico City, Sao Paulo, Tokyo, and Hong Kong. PREI's specialized operating units offer a broad range of investment opportunities and investment management services in the United States, Europe, Asia, Latin America and Australia. PREI’s Principles of Business include doing the right thing, building bridges, valuing our people and working to win; we also place high importance on sustainability.

 

As of March 30, 2013, PREI managed over $52.2 billion in gross real estate assets ($36 billion net) on behalf of clients worldwide and ranks among the largest real estate investment managers. For more information, please visit http://www.prei.com/.

 

Investment Analyst Program:

 

PREI has an Investment Analyst program in the US with positions in all of its US offices. Analysts work with small teams of investment professionals in the Asset Management, Marketing, Merchant Banking, Research, and Transactions units.

 

There currently is an Investment Analyst position available in the Transactions group in San Francisco, CA.

 

Duties and Responsibilities may include:

Analyze and underwrite investment opportunities for the acquisition and development of commercial properties across all property types, investment structures, and risk profiles

Create cash flow models, sensitivity tables, rent roll analyses, joint venture waterfall models, and other financial analyses required to evaluate and pursue commercial real estate acquisition opportunities

Prepare Investment Committee memoranda and related materials through market research, risk analysis, and in-depth understanding of investment factors 

Analyze economic, market, legal, and political conditions within assigned areas 

Assist senior transactions professionals in leading the due diligence and closing processes for acquisitions in conjunction with portfolio and asset management teams 

 Assist asset management teams in property financings, appraisal review, and other activities that may require feedback from the Transactions group

Monitor and/or track acquisition and disposition activity

Assist in property and portfolio level financing

Research and analyze potential new partners and investment ideas

 

Training Opportunities:

 

·         The Analyst Program is designed to immerse Analysts in PREI's business strategy, principles, and values

·         Analysts are encouraged to participate in the CFA program to enhance their knowledge of finance principles

·         Analysts are also are eligible to participate in the Regional Mentor Program, an opportunity to be coached by more experienced professionals with whom they can develop insightful one-on-one relationships and ensure continued professional progress to suit long-term career interests

fields.description:
Professional Services Technical Analyst

Company Profile

Founded in 1997, Calypso Technology is a leading global application software provider for the capital markets industry, delivering an integrated suite of trading, risk and processing applications within many of the premier financial institutions including banks, asset managers, hedge funds, and other companies participating in the world’s financial markets.

Its innovative platform is the industry’s first integrated application suite with the ability to support the trading, risk management, and processing of various financial products such as Interest Rate, Credit, Foreign Exchange, Commodity and Equity and their derivatives.

With strategically based offices in global financial centers in San Francisco (headquarters), New York, London, Paris, Frankfurt, Copenhagen, Moscow, Johannesburg, Sydney, Tokyo, Singapore, Hong Kong, Beijing, Mumbai and Chennai, our 500+ employees include some of the best talent from the capital markets and technology industries. Our global presence offers international exposure, experience and travel for many of our employment positions.

Calypso Technology's clients are industry innovators and leaders — from 8 of the world’s top 10 banks to regional and local banks, and the world’s largest asset managers , leading hedge funds , and insurance companies. With over 110+ customers and 18,000+ users around the world, we are extremely proud of the relationships we have developed. A partial list of our clients can be found here : www.calypso.com/customers/

With a world-class team of professionals who share a passion to succeed, Calypso places a high value on providing equal employment opportunities and maintaining a diverse workforce.

We invite you to explore the Calypso website and discover how our organization can help you to navigate your journey in finding a rewarding career and achieving your own personal and professional goals.

Job Description Overview

Calypso Technology is seeking is seeking a Post-Sales Senior Technical Analyst with relevant work experience in the capital markets or at a financial software company. The ideal candidate will have strong Java development skills with enterprise application experience.

Responsibilities

  • In-depth, hands-on involvement directly with customers implementing the Calypso system. A key responsibility will be working directly with the customer project team implementing the Calypso system, and assist them in implementing their users’ requirements. The technical analyst will then typically follow up with the users to test the implementation, achieve signoff, and continue to move the system toward go-live.
  • Assist developers in understanding the API required to extend the Calypso system, add data to the Calypso system, and build interfaces between Calypso and external systems.
  • Train users and customer developers on the basic use of the system, particularly with the technical setup.
  • System installation, including Java JRE download and installation, relational database installation, data model installation and upgrade scripts, setup and configuration of event-driven framework, configuration of real-time market data feed, etc.
  • Work hands on with the system, configuring it and testing that it meets the customer’s technical requirements.
  • Work with Calypso business analysts, Calypso core development, or customer development to code prototypes of enhancements to ensure they will meet business requirements.
  • Some technical project management work will be expected. In particular, managing the technical issues and tracking the timeline of technical deliverables, in order to keep the customer informed of progress. Assist customers with development of their own internal project plan, including identification of key setup and configuration tasks, scope considerations, timeline and scheduling, and resource requirements.

Skills & Requirements:

  • 4+ years working in systems or technical analysis, preferably in the capital markets industry
  • 5+ years of experience in commercial software including Java, C++, Swing, JDBC, RMI, J2EE, Linux, Sybase, XML (exceptional candidates with less experience will be considered)
  • Strong GUI and server side development
  • Excellent object-oriented analysis, design & development skills
  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL including working experience with Sybase and/or Oracle
  • Preference for domain experience in developing software or implementing software in support of any or all of the following asset classes: credit derivatives, interest rate derivatives, equity derivatives, fixed income, or FX.
  • Experience designing/building front-to-back capital markets trading systems will be especially valuable.
  • Strong business skills – even though this is a technical position, the candidate must be very “business savvy” – ability to comfortably interact with end users on business operations will be highly valued. Particular value will be placed on understanding basic concepts of trade capture and trade workflow management, market data capture, cash flow generation, trade valuation, sensitivity analysis, payment advice and settlement creation, general ledger accounting, and securities position management.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills. The person in this role will spend significant amounts of time working hands-on educating and training customers, and patience will be key to success.
  • Willingness and ability to travel periodically, as required.

Benefits

Calypso offers career development opportunities, a competitive compensation package, and a comprehensive benefits package

Calypso Technology is an equal opportunity employee (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.

fields.description:
Facebook is seeking a Manager, Technical Accounting. This position is full-time and located in our Menlo Park, CA headquarters.

Responsibilities
  • Monitor the activities of all accounting standard setting bodies to ensure timely identification of emerging accounting pronouncements
  • lead the quarterly GAAP and SEC updates with the Chief Accounting Officer.
  • Understand and provide interpretation of new accounting pronouncements in order to assist management in assessing financial and operational implications
  • support the implementation of new accounting standards across functional teams within the company where applicable.
  • Review contracts and agreements, research relevant accounting guidance, recommend accounting and financial reporting requirements for complex non-routine transactions, including but not limited to the areas of business combination, share-based compensation and leases.
  • Prepare technical accounting memorandums for significant transactions and support the review process with finance management and external auditors.
  • Conduct financial due diligence of proposed M&A transactions as needed.
  • Support the External Reporting team to ensure proper implementation of new accounting pronouncements
  • participate in the review of quarterly and annual SEC filings
  • assist in the preparation of financial statement disclosures in times of high seasonal demand or in areas with increased complexity.
  • Support various accounting teams with the drafting and review of any new accounting policies or updates of existing policies.

Requirements
  • Bachelor or higher degree in accounting or finance
  • CPA or equivalent qualification
  • Experienced manager tenure in a Big 4 accounting firm, including experience working with the firm’s technical advisory / professional practice group
  • Demonstrated knowledge and ability in researching and documenting new accounting guidance and the accounting treatment of complex issues
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills, particularly the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and precise manner
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Proven self-starter and independent thinker who sets aggressive goals and meets them
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite
  • Demonstrated IFRS knowledge is a plus
  • Experience in a public company preferred
  • Experience with the technology or social media industry preferred
fields.title: Manager, Technical Accounting

fields.description:
Financial Analyst I

Prepares and maintains financial models and reports for the shared services divisions. Generates new financial models (may design from existing template or create new ones) and reports with oversight from Manager. Manages information for reports, models, and special projects. Works on financial planning and the preparation of operating budgets.

The Financial Analyst supports the Operation Finance Managers II teams by: (i) reporting monthly expense activities (ii) supporting annual and quarterly expense forecasting (iii) preparing accruals and supporting monthly expense processing (iv) creating expense models and preparing information for cost benefit analyses and tracking both costs and benefits within the Shared Services divisions (v) leading expense benchmarking activities for the Operations Finance team.

Essential Functions:

  1. Prepare monthly analysis of actual vs. budget expense by department and category, analyzing and interpreting key variances, issues and trends. Maintain and develop reporting, automating processes wherever possible, manage and reconcile data from multiple sources, provide reporting (quarterly forecasts, operational plans, budgets, actuals, variance tracking, etc.) to cost center managers and executives.
  2. Support the operational expense Planning and Budgeting process working to provide key information, tools, analysis, insights, etc. to the organization influencing the development of overall objectives and goals of the division. Provide analysis of key assumptions during the planning process and review plans and budgets for consistency. Help to develop presentation materials for managers and must be able to help identify and frame important issues, include appropriate content, as well as refine existing presentations.
  3. Monthly invoice processing plus monthly and year-end accruals. Document the invoice process and support current staff performing the tasks. Prepare month-end and year-end accruals based upon accounting rules and historical trends for expenses by division.
  4. Model creation and cost/benefit analyses. Create financial models to simulate future expense scenarios with multiple variables over 1-10 year time periods. For specific projects within CSAA IG, collaborate with multiple stakeholders to estimate revenue and expense or capital requirements for the project. Track actual revenue and expenses as the project is managed to completion.
  5. Benchmarking. Translate financial and statistical information from CSAA IG into the standardized format for multiple benchmarking vendors. Review the results with the benchmarking vendors to eliminate misclassifications and reconcile benchmark figures to CSAA IG financial statements. Educate finance managers and executives about the nuances of each benchmark.

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Self- starter with impeccable ethics and integrity, as well as proven communication skills, verbal and written, with a clear ability to effectively communicate amongst different levels of the organization.
  • Strong analytical skills to effectively interpret problems and develop solutions
  • Knowledge in the use and development of financial models.
  • Strong interpersonal and inter-departmental skills that support effective relationship with team and other departments.
  • Experience in preparing monthly financial management reports
  • Demonstrated ability to work within tight deadlines and timelines, with proven experience in meeting goals on time.

Education, Knowledge, Skills, Competencies, Certifications, Licenses:

0-1 years of experience in finance or related area required. Bachelors’ degree with emphasis in Finance, Business Administration or Accounting or equivalent experience and education required. Experience supporting the General and Administrative functions highly desired. Insurance industry experience desired but not compulsory. Excellent analytical, reporting, data manipulation and problem solving skills required. Advanced PC spreadsheet and presentation software skills required. Excellent communication skills required.
fields.title: Financial Analyst I

fields.description:
FP&A BPC ADMINISTRATOR / FINANCIAL ANALYST #1624151

The Corporate Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) organization leads the company-wide financial forecasting, budgeting and reporting processes. This organization also provides analytics to support decision making, benchmarking, and improve business results. Our finance FP&A team has the critical role for a Business Systems Analyst to support our Financial Systems, SAP Business Objects Planning (BPC) financial forecasting and reporting system. Additionally, this person will also provide support to the Corp FP&A team with financial forecasting and reporting processes.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
- SAP BPC Finance System administrator responsible for maintaining the financial models, security and all system administrations roles
- Maintain Nvidia's BPC Database which includes Models for Labor Planning, OPEX, Capital Spending, Product Development (Non Labor R&D Costs), Supply Demand Optimization, Profit and Loss.
- Partner with Finance, IT and other stakeholders organizations assessing finance system process issues, identifying improvements, and implementing new solutions.
* Leveraging existing finance systems, support new biz model development, financial modeling and derive necessary changes.
* Drive process innovation activities to improve FP&A forecasting accuracy and efficiency. (ex: Inventory reserve/release forecasting)
* SDO - Administer/improve product margin forecasting process using Supply Demand Optimizer Engine. Analyze BU finance report requirement and work with IT to develop more BI reports.
* Revenue Recognition System Upgrade to latest offering
- Communicate and execute BPC finance system updates, monthly forecasting and reporting process support requirements.
- Develop and maintain user BPC documentation (Ex. inputs sheets, reports, templates, etc.) for system users, and provide training on SAP BPC software to system stakeholders.
- Provide forecasting, reporting and analytical support to Corp FP&A, as needed, for our Corporate and Business Unit P&Ls, Operating Expenses, Capital Spending, and Headcount Planning.
- Become knowledgeable of all Nvidia Financial Systems SAP R/3, BW, Product Costing, FI/CO, HR systems which interface with Finance systems

REQUIRED SKILLS:
- Superuser in the use of OLAP (Online Analytical Processing) database software tools, such as BPC.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to summarize complex and technical issues / analysis into simple and clear messaging for senior management.
- Strong financial analytical and modeling skills
- Proactive and independent person who identifies issues and drives them to resolution
- Demonstrated ability to establish effective relationships at all levels of an organization.
- Ability to prioritize and organize assignments and execute in a fast paced environment.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
- Bachelor degree in Finance, Accounting, Computer and Information Sciences, Management Information Systems, or related field.
- Strong financial systems background and expertise.
- 4 yrs. Financial Systems experience with SAP Data warehouse and forecasting tools (at least one of the following&BPC, Hyperion, Business Objects, Cognos).
- SAP FI/CO, BPC implementation experience
- SAP BW/BO super user level experience
- IT system project or process improvement project leadership experience.

EOE

fields.description:
Greystripe, a division of ValueClick, is the largest brand-focused mobile advertising network in the US by reach. Greystripe delivers the engagement for brand marketers and performance for direct response advertisers via our sophisticated targeting platform that leverages proprietary data from all connected devices. Greystripe leverages billions of rich media impressions to 85 million users of touch-driven devices and through our synergies with the ValueClick enterprise link consumers across all devices at an individual level.

Greystripe was named one of the Top Ten Most Innovative Companies in Mobile by Fast Company in 2011, the MOBI Awards’ Best Mobile Rich Media Network in 2010, E-Tech CTIA award winner for the Mobile Marketing/Mobile Advertising category in 2009, AlwaysOn OnMedia 100 winner in 2009, AlwaysOn Global 100 winner in 2008, Red Herring Global 100 winner in 2007 and the Under the Radar Best in Show: Mobility winner in 2006.
As a competitive, motivated, sales pro, you will utilize your in-depth understanding of the online media industry and complexities of the underlying technology from either an ad sales or media planning perspective. Drive new mobile business and strategic engagements with top marketers and ad agencies. Work in an entrepreneurial environment that is performance-driven. With tremendous upside earning potential, you will enjoy delivering exceptional results and continually exceeding sales goals. You will utilize your strong problem-solving skills to provide custom solutions based on client marketing objectives while you proficiently communicate the subject of online advertising technologies, including cross platform solutions, optimization, advanced targeting, inventory sources, attribution analysis and trading desks.

Requirements

Essential Functions and Responsibilities

· Customarily and regularly exercises business discretion and independent judgment with respect to matters of significance related to sales.

· Build a business plan and develop strategy around core clients and prospects to foster growth and new business acquisition

· Drive business forward with agency and client direct relationships.

· Work closely with product marketing, business development and operations to enhance and refine sales products, sales offerings and sales materials.

· Proven ability to close new sales and maintain client relationships for repeat sales at all levels within buy side (marketing manager to CMO and planner to Group Media Director)

· Ability to hit quarterly target revenue quotas.

· Ability to work independently and be a self-starter.

· Special Projects as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

· Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.

· Strong business acumen

· Exceptional organizational, presentation, verbal and written communication skills

· Proven record in digital and interactive ad sales:

  • Must have met and exceeded prior sales goals
  • Large-account sales and sales program management necessary
  • Experience growing relationship value over time
  • Track record of strong revenue generating long term relationships – built from scratch

    • · You are a strategic thinker with the ability to translate marketer needs into compelling concepts and solutions

    · Understanding of mobile market place and technologies and willingness to learn quickly

    · Ability and desire to manage ad programs through the entire advertising cycle; from business relationship to sale, to launch to ad program management, final program reporting and up-sell

    · Ability to develop and cultivate deep relationships at all levels especially Brand Managers to Media Buyers

    · Proven collaboration skills, with ability to work with cross functional teams to achieve sales results

    · Excellent verbal and written communication skills required

    · Strong preference for rolodex of interactive advertising buyers

    · Must be comfortable with changing environments and responsibilities.

    · Must be technically proficient, including Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint

    · Ability to travel as necessary

    Experience and Education

    · Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.

    · 5+ years experience in a related environment, including experience in interactive sales and/or interactive account management
fields.title: Sr. Account Executive (GS)

fields.description:
About Berkeley

The University of California, Berkeley, is one of the world’s most iconic teaching and research institutions. Since 1868, Berkeley has fueled a perpetual renaissance, generating unparalleled intellectual, economic and social value in California, the United States and the world. Berkeley’s culture of openness, freedom and acceptance—academic and artistic, political and cultural—make it a very special place for students, faculty and staff.

Berkeley is committed to hiring and developing staff who want to work in a high performing culture that supports the outstanding work of our faculty and students. In deciding whether to apply for a staff position at Berkeley, candidates are strongly encouraged to consider the alignment of the Berkeley Workplace Culture with their potential for success at http://jobs.berkeley.edu/why-berkeley.html.

Application Review Date

The First Review Date for this job is: October 29, 2013

Departmental Overview

This position is located in the Office of the Executive Vice Chancellor & Provost (EVCP). The EVCP is the Chief Academic Officer of the University of California, Berkeley and acts for the Chancellor in his absence. The EVCP shares responsibility with the Chancellor for the overall leadership and management of the campus and advises the Chancellor on all campus issues. In an administrative role, the EVCP is responsible for executive oversight of the vice chancellors and campus operations. As Provost, he is Berkeley’s chief academic officer and responsible for the largest and most complex control unit on campus.

The Financial Analyst 3 position provides analytic support for the financial operations of the Immediate Office of the Executive Vice Chancellor and Provost (EVCP) and units within the EVCP division as well as the two Vice Provosts which report to the EVCP: the Vice Provost for Teaching, Learning, Academic Planning and Facilities (VP-TLAPF) and the Vice Provost for the Faculty (VP-F). The Financial Analyst 3 position works as part of the EVCP Finance and Administration Unit to provide financial support to units in four divisions: EVCP division, VP-TLAPF division, VP-F division and the division of the Academic Senate.

The Financial Analyst position reports to the Director of Finance and Administration for the EVCP and works with the Director and the team on short and long term financial issues. The position collaborates with the team members on researching and analyzing financial policies and interpreting and communicating those policies to unit managers and administrators.

Responsibilities

FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT 50%
Applies professional concepts to perform moderate to complex analysis to understand past performance and determine present and future performance and/or resource allocations. Coordinates and implements department budget allocations, conceives of and maintains department chart of accounts or other data management tools, and related business processes.

•Performs SAS (Statement on Auditing Standards) review of monthly financial ledger as well as the SAS review of monthly payroll ledger, reviewing Page Center reports for accuracy of dollar amounts and chartstrings. Submits requests to CSS for any necessary pay adjustments or expense transfers based on this review.
•Reviews BAIRS summary and detail reports for deficit balances, erroneous charges, incorrect chartstrings, and proper ledger documentation.
•Ascertains needed ledger adjustments, prepares financial journals for expense transfers and prepares operating transfer journals for reallocating divisional funds.
•Ensures revenues, allocations, and internal transfers are properly budgeted, transacted, reconciled and documented.
•Prepares deposits through the Campus Deposit System (CDS) as necessary.

BUSINESS AND FINANCIAL SERVICES LIAISON TO CAMPUS SHARED SERVICES (CSS) 25%
Provides department support in the areas of business process analysis and design, system or procedure testing and implementation, documentation, security, workflow, and customer feedback.

•Acts as liaison to CSS in the area of Business and Financial Services. Provides guidance to divisional units regarding processes for on-line transactions utilizing BearBuy, bluCard, and Travel and Entertainment. Oversees internal procedures for payment approvals and routing.
•Acts as approver for unit and divisional bluCard transactions and reviews Cal 1 card transactions.
•Revises and implements procedures to improve and streamline the business process interface with CSS.

BUDGETING 15%
Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for financial and/or resource plans, including annual resource allocation approaches, trended future requirements, operating forecasts, sources and uses, etc.

•Using the CalPlanning, CalReporting and BAIRS systems, works with other members of the Finance and Administration Team in the preparation and analysis of budget reports and projections.
•Maintains HCM/HCP position management system, responsible for integrity of financial data. Supports budgetary management and analysis of all approved positions across all funding sources.
•Responds to requests for customized budget reports (e.g., for grant reporting) from unit and division managers.

DATA ANALYSIS 5%
Performs complex financial or resource research and studies for a variety of internal department constituents. Provides analytical support for complex budget, financial, or resource analysis projects.

•Assists Director with data analysis assignments, primarily quantitative and financial in nature. Provides support for management and costing analysis studies and analysis on resource allocation matters.
•Assists with other ad-hoc analytical studies. Assignments typically deal with complex and/or sensitive matters.

SPECIAL PROJECTS 5%

Examples include generating, modifying, and conceiving of new financial or other resource reports, or analyzing and forecasting staff/faculty salary budgets, contracts, grants, gifts, endowments, or user fees.

•Assists control unit staff in responding to special project requests from senior management.

Required Qualifications

•Demonstrated ability to independently gather and organize information, and perform financial analysis assignments.
•Ability to present information in a clear and concise manner both in writing and verbally.
•Proven ability to understand, articulate and adapt university accounting, payroll, and purchasing policies and procedures.
•Experience in developing budgets, conducting strategic/financial planning and forecasting, and designing financial reports.
•Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office and common desktop/web applications.
•Has demonstrated ability to work well as a member of a team as well as independently
•Has demonstrated ability to juggle multiple assignments and priorities with minimal supervision
•Ability to maintain confidentiality
•Bachelors degree in related area and/or equivalent experience/training.

Preferred Qualifications

•Extensive knowledge of University’s financial and budgetary processes, policies, and practices.
•Proficiency in the use of campus budgeting and finance systems (e.g., BFS, BAIRS, CalPlanning).

Salary & Benefits

For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University visit:

http://atyourservice.ucop.edu/forms_pubs/misc/benefits_of_belonging.pdf

How to Apply

Please submit your cover letter and resume as a single attachment when applying.

Criminal Background Check

This position has been designated as sensitive and may require a Criminal Background Check. We reserve the right to make employment contingent upon successful completion of a Criminal Background Check.
­

Equal Employment Opportunity

The University of California, Berkeley is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
fields.title: Financial Analyst (7709U) #16772

fields.description:
Chase is the U.S. consumer and commercial banking business of JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM), a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.3 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries We serve more than 50 million consumers and small businesses through more than 5,600 bank branches, 18,700 ATMs, credit cards, mortgage offices and online and mobile banking as well as through relationships with auto dealerships.

As a Chase employee, you'll be part of a company that makes a real difference every day for our customers, our communities and ourselves. With a focus on customer service, you'll put others first, do what's right and create solutions that make lives better. We invite you to build your career on our strong foundation and help shape what's next - for you and for us.

The Mobile Banking, E-Commerce and Payments (MEP) organization is a motivated, cross-functional team comprised of high-talent individuals with a concentrated focus on delivering innovative banking services to the most important platforms of today and tomorrow. The MEP team has grown from 50 to 150 employees in just over a year and is responsible for setting and executing the strategies behind Mobile Banking, Digital Marketing, Social Media, Web/Mobile Payments and Innovation.

As a Quality Assurance Analyst, you will perform risk based end to end system tests. You will also develop test scripts based upon communication and discussions with Business and End Users in line with defined workflows and use cases; process transactions from system entry to exit; test new and modified functionality delivered across applications and workflows; and test applications to demonstrate that relevant existing system functionality remains as expected.

Key responsibilities include:
  • Develop testing processes and approaches according to JPMC Chase standards.
  • Assist in designing and ensuring overall integrity of the testing strategy.
  • Work with appropriate business and technology leads to determine the acceptable range for test results and performance.
  • Help design, develop and implement test plans, scripts, tools using the detailed business requirements, functional requirements and design documents.
  • Work with business and technology leads to identify the appropriate data for testing, and prepare that data for the test cases.
  • Assist Application Developers and technical support staff in identifying and resolving problems.
  • Facilitate resolution and communication of cross-application/organization architectural issues and decisions.
  • Assess and revise test sequence and scope based upon test results and/or changes in product design.
  • Coordinate component, system and documentation testing with the appropriate technical groups.
  • Document test procedures and findings.
  • Reconcile test results from different tests and different groups.
  • Assess readiness and deviation of product/project performance based upon test results and product specifications.
  • Identify automation candidates

Qualifications

  • 5+ years applications development or quality assurance testing experience
  • 5+ years experience with manual testing, testing tools, writing test plans, and reviewing test cases for technical and/or business clients experience
  • Preferred skills:
    • 2+ year experience testing in Mobile Application
    • 3+ years experience in Banking and Finance

May place orders on behalf of broker. Guidance is provided to perform varied work of substantial variety and complexity, requiring evaluation, originality and ingenuity in making moderately complex decisions. Recommends solutions to complex problems. Extensive contact with internal and external customers is required to obtain, clarify or provide facts and information.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Tracks and confirms transactions to ensure accuracy.
  • Prepares management reports, as required.
  • Advises others in resolving complex problems and issues.
  • Maintains and updates account files.
  • Performs administrative tasks, including faxing, filing and copying.
  • Serves as liaison between client and sales and/or trading personnel.
  • Maintains currency in organizational and industry current events and best practices.
  • Plans, organizes and maintains effective and efficient workflow.
  • Accesses, interprets and applies market and client information; prioritizes flow of information; and communicates to appropriate personnel.
  • Initiates client transaction related communication to support sales and/or trading activities.
  • Executes trades, as required.
  • Participates in face to face client meetings.
  • Assists in compliance review process.

  • Concepts, principles and practices of securities trading/sales.
  • Procedures for processing trades.
  • Market levels, including accuracy of bids and offerings.

Skill in:

  • Performing qualitative and quantitative data analysis.
  • Analyzing problems and developing creative solutions.
  • Attending to detail while ensuring quality standards are met without impacting workflow.
  • Developing and maintaining effective workflow processes.
  • Selecting and using a variety of technical tools such as Bloomberg, Miter, Account Assignment Story Bond and MuniRecap.

fields.description:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. Our team of Financial Analysts foster the financial health of our organization by partnering closely with our various functions, tracking performance metrics and creating financial models. Our Financial Analysts are up to date with the latest economic trends and apply knowledge around rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements and investment performance to the projects at hand. As a Financial Analyst, you are called upon to build complex scenarios analyses that serve as the basis for recommendations that leaders of the business draw from to make critical strategic decisions. A master juggler working on multiple projects at a time, you maintain a consistently high level of attention to detail while finding creative ways to tackle financial challenges.

Patent litigation is an exciting and rapidly growing field at the intersection of law, technology and innovation. Google is battling a large number of patent threats directed at core products such as search, ads, cell phones, video and an array of others. Some of these disputes are high-stakes battles the outcome of which could impact not just Google, but the entire Internet ecosystem and its billions of users. A key component to defending against patent threats involves attacking the financial incentives for bringing these claims against Google, and in particular, the claimants’ damages theories. In the Patent Litigation Financial Analyst role, you will marshall the best evidence and analysis to support Google’s positions on such issues for our large and complex docket of patent litigation matters. In addition, this role will contribute to issues relating to varied and interesting tasks that include patent-related licensing, dispute resolution (pre-litigation and litigation), acquisition, deals and policy work. You will work with Google’s financial and accounting teams, engineers, product developers, executives and other legal team members, and will be responsible for working closely with outside counsel and outside experts. Our Patent team is an invigorating, inspiring team of innovators and attorneys who are passionate about future technologies and excited about resolving their ensuing legal challenges. As a member of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to develop and implement Google's strategy to protect, defend and capture the value of its patents.

As a Financial Analyst in the Patent Litigation group, you will support the litigation attorneys in building the strongest case to rebut plaintiff’s (often outlandish) damages claims. You will work closely with Google accounting, finance, and engineering teams to ensure that we have the appropriate data to support our cases and our positions. This will involve marshalling relevant data and helping shape the appropriate analysis of the data such that we can best present our position to the courts and juries who ultimately decide our cases. You will also help assess new cases as they are filed against us. In addition, in this role you will assist our team in gathering data on cases and maintaining our database of case tracking information, maintaining our document repositories, analyzing historical case data and providing summary information, preparing presentation materials for case management and assisting with a variety of other tasks necessary for the efficient management of a large and growing docket of litigation matters. As a member of our team, you will enjoy a fast-paced and dynamic work environment with constantly evolving technologies and a goal of continual improvement.


Responsibilities
  • Work closely with Patent Litigators and other Legal groups to gather relevant financial information relating to our patent cases.
  • Work closely with outside counsel and outside economic experts to best shape our strategy in dealing with damages issues in our patent cases.
  • Develop and maintain financial expertise regarding Google broad array of products and services.
  • Help maintain historical case information and assist with analysis of such data and preparation of presentations for management.
  • Gather, organize and maintain document repositories of forms, exemplars and best practices for case management.



    • Minimum Qualifications

  • BA/BS degree degree in technical, financial or accounting fields or equivalent practical experience.


    • Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with litigation and/or patent law especially as it relates to damages issues
  • Strong experience working with spreadsheets, presentation software, scripting languages, and statistical analysis tools
  • Distinctive problem-solving and analytical skills, combined with strong grasp of technological issues
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal and team skills and sense of humor


    • Area

    The name Google came from ""googol,"" a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

fields.description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a driven and dynamic individual to join the Trading team and be responsible for creating, optimising, and maintaining sales planning and performance for NOW TV.

This is a high profile role with touch points across the business including; Marketing, Insight, and Finance, and will also work closely with the Business Science team of our media planning agency. The role will initially have line management responsibility for one commercial analyst

NOW TV is the new internet TV service from Sky, offering access to Sky content on a wide range of broadband-connected devices. NOW TV provides instant access to some of Sky’s most popular content, including hundreds of films from Sky Movies and for the first time ever, Sky Sports on a pay as you go basis with the new Day Pass. With a distinctive look and identity, it stands out from the existing Sky TV service and offers even more choice and flexibility to customers.

We are currently in an exciting period of rapid growth as we expand our product offering and routes to market in which we sell, and joining the NOW TV team at this early stage provides a real opportunity for individuals to directly contribute to the future success of the service.

You will own the sales performance and forecast for NOW TV; balancing plans, targets, budgets and performance across all our online and offline media channels to achieve the most efficient sales plan.

Planning
*Together with our media agency, utilise headroom insights and econometric analysis to forecast future quarter sales scenarios with different inputs.
*Use insight from previous quarters to inform future strategy and most efficient use of budgets and present rationale to the leadership team.
*Identify sales strategies and offer plans which deliver the best cost per acquisition and continuously improve this metric quarter on quarter.
*Provide input to the the annual and quarterly sales planning process, working closely with the marketing team and our media agency to pull together the overall sales plans for customer acquisition.
*Support finance in the budget management and forecasting cycle.

In Quarter Management
*Deliver accurate latest views for customer acquisition, providing detailed analysis of trends and variance.
*Build and maintain the sales plan to forecast and drive the repeat purchase rate of Sports passes by existing customers.
*Continuously review performance, anticipate issues and plan mitigation activity where required.
*Set up and run weekly trading meetings across departments to track and manage performance.
*Actively manage and optimise budgets in-quarter and re-allocate budgets to best performing activity where required.
*Provide a quarterly summary of performance across all key metrics and campaigns, to inform future planning.

The Trading Controller will need to have great analytical skills, attention to detail and an innate ability to spot trends within large amounts of information and data. You’ll have excellent communication skills and be able to present complex ideas simply. Previous team management experience is preferred but not essential.
It is essential that you have a proven track record of building sales plans to deliver sales targets, have the ability to present forecasts and sales activity and explain financial models to senior stakeholders. Knowledge of sales & marketing principles and sales pipelines is a must and it would be highly desirable if you had an understanding of digital marketing principles and web analytics and an understanding of multichannel attribution. Strong excel skills modelling and manipulation skills are key requirements.

On top of great training and development opportunities, discounted subscription TV, Broadband and Talk services, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlements, enhanced Maternity & Paternity benefits , contribution pension scheme, a share-save scheme, plus Sky Choices, a benefit scheme to help you make valuable tax and national insurance savings.

Sky delivers some of the most diverse content and services on the planet, and we value the same diversity within our business. We provide a culture of entrepreneurialism and opportunity for one and all.

It’s our people that make Sky the UK and Ireland' leading entertainment company. That’s why we work hard to be an inclusive employer, so everyone at Sky can be their best

Believe in Better – Join In!

Due to the fast paced nature of Sky’s Businesses our vacancy close dates may be subject to change.

fields.description:
“Exciting opportunity for success and career advancement with one of the largest FX Brokers in the world”

FXCM (NYSE:FXCM) is one of the world’s largest currency trading brokers seeking career-oriented, entry-level candidates ready to start a career in financial services.

Top Benefits:

  • Paid travel to Texas office for training
  • Quarterly bonuses for top performers
  • Strong team dynamic with frequent outings
  • Located in the heart of downtown San Francisco

High performing employees within the Financial Services Representative team have historically been promoted into a wide range of positions including management, sales, trading education, private client services, marketing, training, and even travelled to some of our worldwide offices!

Starting a career in the global currency market - The top two reasons candidates apply to work within the currency (Forex) market are Growth and Opportunity.

 

How the Forex Market is Growing

  • Over 4 Trillion in volume done each day – compared to 150 Million in global stock markets
  • Retail traders accounting for 18% of daily volume during 2011; up from 10% in 2010
  • Join a Team at FXCM with Record Growth every year since 1999 – even during 2008 and 2009’s global financial crisis

Description of Ideal Candidates:

 

  • Market Junkies.  You actively follow financial markets, financial news, and can easily name 2-3 stories at a minimum that you’ve recently read.  You’d love to talk about opinions on global markets, trading strategies, and current world affairs.
  • Career Minded.  You are interested in starting a long-term career with FXCM and within finance and (most importantly) you are able to articulate how FXCM fits in your long-term plans.
  • Entry-Level Applicant.  You have 0-3 years professional experience in a full-time position and have a genuine interest in working your way up.

 

Unique Opportunities that FXCM Provides

  • Develop an array of Skills in: Customer Support, Sales, Trading, and many more
  • Meritocracy – 2 years or less is the usual time frame for top performing employees to be promoted to more senior roles
  • Opportunities abound with an increase in global partnerships

To learn more about the forex market and FXCM, please visit this link: http://www.fxcm.com/forex-educational-videos.jsp

Key responsibilities include (not limited to):

  • Provide our clients with best-in-class service on phone, chats, and email.
  • Intelligently articulate financial and market-related concepts
  • Mediate difficult situations, conversations and customers with composure and resolve
  • Consistently take initiative to learn about the markets, FX industry and new FXCM platforms and products such as the FXCM Trading Station, Meta Trader 4, or the latest iPad release
  • Be a team player and proactively collaborate with the Financial Services Team to manage time, resources, volume, and customer feedback
  • Consistently achieve specific deposit, retention, and customer satisfaction benchmarks
  • Act upon constructive criticism to improve on-desk client conversations and to build on personal and department-wide performance figures
  • Go beyond “customer service.”  Skillfully probe for, listen, and understand client needs to provide resources and solutions to improve clients’ trading experience and results

fields.description:
Financial Analyst

Prepares and maintains financial models and reports for the shared services divisions. These include CFO, IT and CMO. Generates new financial models (may design from existing template or create from scratch) and reports with oversight from Manager. Manages information for reports, models, and special projects. Works on financial planning and the preparation of operating budgets.

Essential Functions

The Financial Analyst supports the Operation Finance Managers II teams by: (i) driving month-end close activities through reviewing expense accruals/prepays (ii) financial review of new SOWs/ contracts and purchase requisition/PO set-up (iii) supporting the Shared Services Divisions planning processes i.e. forecasts updates and tactical plans (v) financial performance reporting and variance analysis (vi) actively leads/participates in process improvement projects within the Operation Finance team.

  1. Prepare monthly financial reports and variance analysis comparing actuals to latest forecast and budget, and provide insight into remaining forecasted spend and other ad hoc analysis to understand trends and activities. Explain variance comments on the pre-close reports for the assigned divisions and prepare/research follow up variance questions for the controller’s group. Prepare the monthly Business Performance Report (BPR) for review and publication.
  2. Develop reporting, automating processes wherever possible, manage and reconcile data from multiple sources, provide reporting (quarterly forecasts, operational plan, budget, actuals, variance tracking, etc.) to cost center/budget managers and executives.
  3. Support the Operational expense Planning and Budgeting process working to provide key information, tools, analysis, insights, etc. to the organization influencing the development of overall objectives and goals of the division. Provide analysis of key assumptions during the planning process and review plans and budgets for consistency.
  4. Help to develop presentation materials for managers and must be able to help identify and frame important issues, include appropriate content, as well as refine existing presentations.

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Self- starter with impeccable ethics and integrity, as well as proven communication skills, verbal and written, with a clear ability to effectively communicate amongst different levels of the organization.
  • Strong analytical skills to effectively interpret problems and develop solutions
  • Advance knowledge in the use and development of financial models.
  • Strong interpersonal and inter-departmental skills that support effective relationship with team and other departments.
  • Experience in preparing monthly financial management reports using Hyperion
  • Demonstrated ability to work within tight deadlines and timelines, with proven experience in meeting goals on time.

3-5 yrs of experience in finance or related area required. Bachelors degree with emphasis on Business Admin, Finance, or Accounting or equivalent experience and education required. Experience supporting the G&A functions highly desired. Excellent analytical, reporting, data manipulation and problem solving skills required. Advance PC modeling skills. Excellent communication skills required.

Analysts are an important part of our banking team.  They conduct extensive industry research and analyze markets and their participants – both financially and strategically – to draw insights regarding profit drivers, competitive positioning and growth opportunities.  Analysts work closely with Associates, Principals and Managing Directors in all aspects of both the solicitation of new business and execution of transactions on behalf of clients.  They are an integral part of small transaction teams completing deals ranging from $15 to $700 million in value.  This position presents an opportunity for qualified candidates to develop an expansive knowledge of investment banking practices and products, including complex domestic and cross-border mergers & acquisitions, debt and equity financings, minority and majority recapitalizations, restructurings, and advisory services including takeover defense, fairness and solvency opinions and valuations.  Specific duties will include:

  • Financial modeling and analysis across a wide range of industries
  • Drafting of descriptive memoranda for sale and financing assignments
  • Creating materials for advisory assignments, including fairness and valuation opinion presentations
  • Identifying, evaluating and contacting potential targets or acquirers
  • Organizing and coordinating due diligence sessions with transaction counterparties
  • Preparing presentations and pitch material for solicitation of new business

fields.description:
About Piper Jaffray

Piper Jaffray is a leading, international middle-market investment bank serving the needs of middle market corporations, private equity groups, public entities and institutional investors. Headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota, the firm has additional investment banking offices in New York, San Francisco, and London. Piper Jaffray investment banking specializes in a variety of financial transactions and focuses on the needs of growth companies in the healthcare industrials & clean technology and renewables, consumer, financial institutions, technology, media, telecommunications, and business services sectors. Piper Jaffray is one of the premier investment banks focused solely on the middle market.

We are currently looking to add an experienced analyst to our Industrials/Clean Tech team in Minneapolis.

Experienced Analyst:

Our Analysts work closely with senior bankers to make a real impact on our clients’ businesses through involvement in all facets of investment banking activities including equity and debt offerings, valuations, private placements, mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts and strategic advisory work. On a day-to-day basis our analysts:

  • Create financial models
  • Conduct financial valuations
  • Create and maintain industry-specific business development books
  • Conduct industry- and company-specific research
  • Interact with clients and senior bankers

Our environment is collaborative, demanding, fast-paced and entrepreneurial. Our clients are extraordinarily dynamic and our people have what it takes to excel.

Qualifications

We are looking for an Analyst with 1 – 2 years of Investment Banking experience with formal training.

Piper Jaffray seeks dedicated and motivated individuals possessing demonstrated academic achievement as well as leadership, organizational and teamwork skills. The ability to create innovative solutions, articulate complex ideas and adapt to a rapidly changing environment is essential. Analysts must be able to work well under pressure and manage multiple projects.

Analyst Career Path

Piper Jaffray is dedicated to supporting analysts as they complete their two-year commitment. Top performers may have the option of a third year. Direct promotions to associate level positions are also available.

Analysts interested in pursuing opportunities outside of the firm will have the opportunity to participate in a program designed to give information and networking contacts for opportunities in private equity, corporate development and business school.

Piper Jaffray is an equal opportunity employer.

Piper Jaffray is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

fields.description:
As a Financial Analyst you provide financial support and/or analysis in budgeting, planning, business processes, or reporting to a portion of a functional organization or to more senior finance staff. You will perform economic research and studies and financial modeling to help future business planning decisions, and create reports and summaries as required by corporate procedure or compliance regulations. You will interface with cross-functional peers and managers and have an opportunity to contribute across various business challenges. In this entry-level role, you will have the opportunity to build customer service and financial analysis skills as you contribute directly to department goals and deliverables.
We are seeking full time University hires that are pursuing or possess a degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or an equivalent degree with a tentative start date of May/June 2014. These positions are located in our Sunnyvale, CA.

Essential Functions:
- The Financial Analysts role has responsibility for a wide range of financial support and analysis tasks. You will help to ensure that departmental objectives and project deadlines are met. The essential functions of the department include:
- Prepare and drive operational and financial metrics in support of key decision making.
- Participate in projects related to financial systems or business processes.
- Gather, analyze, prepare and summarize recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements and operating forecasts.
- Work with cross-functional groups to provide technical support to business units including:
- Forecasting
- Budgeting
- Variance analysis
- Cost analysis
- Product pricing
- Financial/Tax reporting
- Regulatory/compliance analysis and reporting
- May focus on an area of specialization.
- Integrate financial processes and operations of the business.

Job Requirements
Requirements:
- Good written and verbal communication skills.
- Good interpersonal communication skills as needed to work successfully with staff and managers within and outside of function.
- Strong analytical skills and ability to work both independently and on cross functional teams.
- Ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization, including remote areas.
- Ability to function well in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with competing priorities.
- Ability to work in a project based environment.
- Ability to follow standard accounting and finance practices, and departmental procedures and processes.
- Strong Microsoft Office skills including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint.

Responsibility and Interaction:
Responsibility:
- The types of tasks this individual is responsible for are well defined and utilize and build understanding of standard principals and practices within a team environment.

Interaction:
- This individual interacts primarily with their direct manager and the technical team on assigned projects, and may communicate with employees in other functions as required.
- Regular and detailed direction is provided, as well as on-going review of activities and priorities.
- The ideal candidate will be an important contributor to team projects.

Education and Experience
- Must be pursuing or possess a degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or an equivalent degree with a tentative start date of May/June 2014.
- No prior experience is required. Most new employees in this position have 0-2 years of experience.
- Generally, a Financial Analyst at this level is learning the practical basics of field in an environment where they can be an important contributor.

fields.description:
Workday is the leader in enterprise-class, software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions for managing global businesses. Our solutions combine the lower cost of ownership of SaaS with a modern approach to applications. Founded by PeopleSoft veterans Dave Duffield and Aneel Bhusri, Workday delivers Human Capital Management, Payroll, Financial Management and Worker Spend Management solutions for midsize and Fortune 500 companies.
Workday is looking for a versatile financial professional to join the team as Senior Financial Analyst for Professional Services. In this newly created position you will partner closely with leaders within the Professional Services organization to assist in finance-related matters including designing, implementing, and managing processes that support our business needs. Workday Professional Services encompasses a broad offering of revenue-generating value-added services that help customers maximize the benefits of Workday’s software applications within their organizations.
As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will join a small team as we build our capabilities and develop the processes to maximize business impact. We’re looking for someone who wants to make their mark on a growing team and develop business partnering skills, is a self-starter, a great communicator and who enjoys collaborating with people with a diverse set of talents, in a dynamic fast paced environment.
Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities
Responsibilities of the position will include:
  • Partnering with general managers within the Professional Services business to forecast revenue and expenses and to develop departmental budgets
  • Monitoring department performance and preparing management reports and analysis on a regular basis (e.g., budget vs. actual and fluctuation analysis)
  • Liaising with Corporate Accounting and Revenue Accounting to ensure correct accounting treatment of transactional activities, including revenue recognition and expense categorization
  • Preparing journal entries related to financial close activities (end-of period accruals, reclass entries, fixed asset accounting)
  • Leveraging the Workday Financials system to automate and scale current processes
  • Developing insights on business performance based on the interpretation of financial results
  • Proposing business process improvements to enhance financial visibility, control and planning effectiveness
The position will report to the Professional Service Finance Manager and also report indirectly to general managers within the Professional Services organization. In addition, the position will provide general and ad hoc support to Corporate FP&A to assist in effectively managing requests for information and analysis from senior management and on-going reporting requirements for the business overall.
Education and Experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting/Finance
  • Minimum of 8 years related experience
  • Prior Professional Services Finance or Accounting experience strongly preferred
  • Software and/or internet industry experience highly desirable
  • High proficiency with MS Excel and Word
  • Experience using a large ERP system; systems implementation experience will be useful
Key Competencies
  • Ability to work independently, with general direction and guidance
  • Excellent analytical and financial modeling skills
  • Experience in the application of accounting principles to periodic financial reporting, planning and forecasting
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Strong organizational and communication skills
  • Ability to learn new concepts and technology quickly
  • Team player
  • Willingness and ability to adapt to the rapid business and organizational changes that accompany a high-growth environment
The Workday Experience is the combination of everything that′s unique about Workday: our culture, our core values, our company meetings, Cantina happy hours, our soccer team, our recognition programs, but most importantly it′s our people. It′s everything that makes us different from your average employer, and everything that makes Workday a great place to spend a workday. At Workday, we are committed to equal employment opportunity.

Workday does not accept resumes from headhunters, placement agencies or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us. Our supplier base is restricted to specified hiring needs. Therefore, any resume received from an unapproved supplier will be considered unsolicited, and Workday will not be obligated to pay a referral or placement fee.*

fields.description:
Sr. Treasury Analyst

ID 2013-2045 Job Location US-CA-San Francisco

Category Accounting/Finance

Options:
- Apply for this job online
- Email this job to a friend

Socialize this job opportunity to a friend, colleague, or family member:

More information about this job:
Overview:

Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you’ll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones. We continue to revolutionize how people create, deliver, and enjoy entertainment worldwide. To do that, we need the absolute best talent, including professionals in finance, the backbone of the company. We’re big enough to give you all the resources you need, and small enough so you can make a real difference and earn recognition for your work. We offer a collegial culture, challenging projects, and excellent compensation and benefits.

This position plays a key role in Dolby’s Treasury Operations. The Senior Treasury Analyst will support all aspects of Treasury operations, cash, foreign exchange and investment management activities.

In this position, you will work collaboratively on all projects with other Dolby’s Finance functions in an effort to scale the Treasury infrastructure in a growing business while still responding quickly and soundly to day-to-day needs. In a Sarbanes-Oxley environment, process controls and discipline are essential. The person in this role should be familiar with Treasury systems and controls that provide accurate and timely information within the bounds of regulatory compliance

Responsibilities:
- Execute daily Treasury operations activities for global cash management and short-term investments. Oversee global daily cash position and monitor global cash status, including short-term investing of excess cash. Execute wire transfers for Treasury related transactions
- Oversee the investment of Dolby’s corporate cash and manage external portfolio managers, establish performance benchmarks and review results with management
- Monitor daily compliance for Dolby’s investment portfolios
- Manage the Custodian’s relationship and prepare monthly/quarterly investment reports for accounting and management
- Prepare short term cash forecast and interest income forecast
- Design, implement, and operate treasury operations processes, taking into considerations of best practices and business needs
- Work with Accounting and Audit to ensure accurate and timely reporting of cash and investments
- Serve as primary liaison between A/P, A/R, Payroll, and the bank service providers
- Assist in day to day insurance risk management activities
- Develop and maintain Treasury policies and procedures
*LIaise with External Reporting on footnotes and disclosures for Treasury investment and foreign exchange sections of SEC filings
*LIaise with IT to oversee company’s banking platform. Ensure the setup meets SOX and applicable policy.
- Participate or lead the implementation of various Treasury systems

Qualifications:
- A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in business finance or accounting. CTP/CCM qualification is preferred
- A minimum of 5 to 6 years finance experience, preferably in domestic and international Treasury with a multinational company
- Must have a basic accounting knowledge and an excellent understanding of macroeconomics including financial markets, financial instruments and investment theory. A strong knowledge of Treasury related FASB is preferred
- Possess knowledge of banking and treasury systems. Prior experience with SAP is a plus
- Must be a critical thinker with attention to details who can seek innovative solutions to complex business/technical issues
- Must be a self-starter, have own initiatives, and possess strong prioritization and organization skills. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and can handle multiple projects simultaneously
- Must have good verbal, written, and presentation skills to articulate ideas and plans clearly, accurately, and effectively with all levels of internal and external audiences
- Must be a team player adept at facilitating an open exchange of ideas and know how to build win/win relationships
